    • Constructor Detail

      • ScrollableLayout

        public ScrollableLayout(int width,
                        int height,
                        int visibleHeight)

      • ScrollableLayout

        public ScrollableLayout(int left,
                        int top,
                        int width,
                        int height,
                        int visibleHeight)
        The default constructor for a component.

        Laying out components is simply relative positioning. So for left (x position), specific how many pixels from the left of the application window you want it to be positioned at. The top is the same, but instead from the top (y position).

        Parameters:
        left - how many pixels from the left
        top - how many pixels from the top

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(com.mrcrayfish.device.core.Laptop laptop,
                   net.minecraft.client.Minecraft mc,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   int mouseX,
                   int mouseY,
                   boolean windowActive,
                   float partialTicks)
        Description copied from class: Layout
        Renders the background of this layout if a Layout.Background has be set. See Layout.setBackground(Background).
        Overrides:
        render in class Layout
        Parameters:
        laptop - a Gui instance
        mc - a Minecraft instance
        x - the starting x rendering position (left most)
        y - the starting y rendering position (top most)
        mouseX - the current x position of the mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the mouse
        windowActive - if the window is active (at front)
        partialTicks - percentage passed in-between two ticks

        mouseY - the y position of the release
